message.content:
cs.MA, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with learning to control a group of cooperative agents with limited sensing capabilities, which is a typical problem in multi-agent systems. Therefore, cs.MA (Multiagent Systems) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also uses deep reinforcement learning to approximate both the Q-function and the policy, which falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The agents being controlled are robots, which suggests cs.RO (Robotics) as another possible sub-category. The paper also deals with policy evaluation, which is a topic in cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper deals with distributed partial observability of the state, which is a topic in cs.SY (Systems and Control).
